title: Getting New Invitations without Leaving Programs

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello there,
I hope all is well!

#Description
When you leave the private program, you get a chance to get a new invitation.
But using this vulnerability, I can get new invitations without leaving private programs.

Steps:
1. Go to any private bug bounty program.
2. Click `Leave Program` button
3. Click `Confirm` button
4. Then you will see a questionnaire form. You can see this text: `When you fill out this questionnaire, we will fast track you for the next invite batch.`    
{F1022548}
5. Click any reason (for example: `Unresponsive`) and click `Submit` button
6. Return to Burp Suite and catch the request:   
{F1022553}
7. Now, send the request to `Repeater` and forward the request.
8. Go to repeater and change the `team_handle` parameter with another private program handle which you have.
9. Send the request and you will see `"was_successful":true`

So you didn't leave the 2nd program but you got a new pending invitation.

Note: Sometimes, I see `"was_successful":true` in response but to be honest, I don't know why.
Yesterday, I sent about 25-30 request with different private programs and I asked `how much pending invitations do I have?` to `support@hackerone.com` and they said `It looks like you currently have 19 pending invitations at this time.`. 
That's why I wanted to report it.

## Impact

Users can get invitations without leaving programs.

activities.message:
By the way, you can't get multiple invitations with same program. If you try send 2 same requests, you will see `"was_successful":false` in response for 2nd request.

Also I wrote wrong note. It should be like this:
> Note: Sometimes, I see `"was_successful":false` in response but to be honest, I don't know why.

Best Regards,
@mygf

Hi @mygf 
Do those 19 pending invites show in your dashboard?
Regards,
@bugseeker

Hi @mygf
I have forwarded your report to the internal team. I will keep you updated.
Regards,
@bugseeker

Thank you @bugseeker,
I have new update, I wrote to support, again and they said `It looks like you now have 26 pending invites!`.
I didn't earn reputations. I didn't left from any program. I used only this attack. But I earned 7 pending invites.     
{F1024229}

That's why I think this is a valid bug.

Best Regards,
@mygf

Hi @mygf - thanks for your report, creative! I've looked at the code and if I'm reading it correctly it seems that this would only work if you'd enter a handle of a program that you've left in the past but didn't fill in a survey for just yet. Can you send us a list of handles you used so I can double check this? Thanks!

Hello @jobert,
Actually I don't remember which teams I used for. That's why I tested on new teams just now.
Here is a few teams which I used this vulnerability:

Hi @mygf - thanks! I just looked and you're at 37 pending invitations :). I've escalated this to the team so they can look into this. We'll get back to you soon. Thanks!

Hi @mygf - thanks again for bringing this to our attention! We pushed a fix just now. Do you mind retesting this? As I'm writing this, I can see that you still have 37 pending invitations, so that's a good datapoint to see if the exploit still works. Thanks!

Hello @jobert,
Thank you for fast response!

I retested it and I see only this response if I didn't leave from the program:

````
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Tue, 13 Oct 2020 05:56:18 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Connection: close
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store
Content-Disposition: inline; filename="response."
X-Request-Id: 3a948c00-2699-41b7-be6a-43b2897bf466
ETag: W/"85c54e2d77123e6f6436a189c6895df1"

cf-request-id: 05c220fb100000cb464d31e200000001
Server: cloudflare
CF-RAY: 5e16d10b4d76cb46-IST
Content-Length: 121

{"data":{"createLeaveProgramSurveyAnswer":{"was_successful":false,"__typename":"CreateLeaveProgramSurveyAnswerPayload"}}}
````

You can see `"was_successful":false`, I mean it's fixed!

Best Regards,
@mygf
Sweet, thanks for confirming the fix, @mygf!

Hello @jobert,
Thank you for reward!

Can I ask why did you change the Attack complexity as High? It's completely under my control.
I didn't understand.     
{F1034536}

Best Regards,
@mygf

Please just check #961841, for exploit it attacker must hack victim's account and change the country. Bounty: $500
Using this report I can earn many many invitations (I earned 37 invitations in 5 minutes) and you paid $500 for this, too.

I think it's really weird :) @jobert 

Best Regards,
@mygf

Hi @mygf - the whole point of invite-only programs is that people are getting invited. As long as you're not submitting anything to them, it'll continue to invite others. If you'd submit reports, you're providing value. Even though you'd be added to many programs, you wouldn't be able to participate in them all at once. Consider those 37 invites as an additional bonus to make some more money :) Either way, we consider this to be a low severity vulnerability because of that. Bounties are based on severity, not the vulnerability itself. Thanks!
ðŸŽŠ

Hi @mygf - a few people called out that I brushed over your disagreement with the updated severity, apologies for that! I wanted to take this opportunity to elaborate on my thinking because they are totally right now that I re-read my last comment.

The programs you were invited to are programs that are supposed to receive invitations. Although you were able to rake in invitations much quicker than normal, the system would still spread them out (sending you <5 per day) and those invitations wouldn't disclose any information that would otherwise be confidential. As you noticed, you weren't invited to 30+ programs over night. Because of that, I felt like the impact on confidentiality was actually None, but that would've reduced the CVSS to 0.0, which I found unfair, too. To compensate for that, I felt like it was justified to increase the Attack Complexity to High because it would require something else to happen for you to receive invitations to the programs immediately.

I hope that clears things up a bit. Let me know if you have any further questions or feedback!
